pull_request.title: Bump the xunit group with 1 update
pull_request.body:
Bumps the xunit group with 1 update: [xunit](https://github.com/xunit/xunit).
Commits
  • 161ce40 v2.5.3
  • b8bfb82 #2795: Collection equality regression with custom comparer on sequence type (...
  • 644d65e Use is null and is not null in assertion tests
  • 2457cf1 Bump up to v2.5.3-pre
  • See full diff in compare view

pull_request.title: Run `SetInitialWorkingDirectoryAsync` before `LoadProfiles`
pull_request.body:
So that if a user runs `Set-Location` in their profile, it's not later overridden.

Fixes https://github.com/PowerShell/vscode-powershell/issues/4788

issue.title: The server never answers to a `initialize` request on Windows over stdio (but it does on Linux) (takes too long loading libraries on Windows)
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the latest version
- [X] Search the existing issues.

### Steps to reproduce

I'm using Neovim as my editor, so I'm using the minimal reproduction of [this issue](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/issues/2810) (but using the `Diagnostic` log level for powershellEditorServices).

1. Open neovim *on windows*
2. Open the file `a.ps1`
3. Nothing happens (the server never answers the `initiliaze` request. There is more info on the logs)

If the same things are done on linux, everything works as expected.

### Expected behavior

```console
PowershellEditorServices should answer the `initialize` request in both windows and linux.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
PowershellEditorServices does not answer the `initiliaze` request on Windows (there is more info in the logs)
```


### Error details

_No response_

### Environment data

```PowerShell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.3.8
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.3.8
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19045
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### Version

3.13

### Visuals

Powershell logs on Linux (everything works fine here):
[pwsh_linux.log](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/files/13056750/pwsh_linux.log)

Neovim LSP logs on Linux (everything works fine here):
[neovim_linux.log](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/files/13056751/neovim_linux.log)

Powershell logs on Windows (it looks like the server takes too long loading some libraries and then cancels the initialize request):
[pwsh_windows.log](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/files/13056753/pwsh_windows.log)

Neovim logs on Windows (there is never a response for the `initialize` requets)
[neovim_windows.log](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/files/13056755/neovim_windows.log)

comment.body: Glad to help and happy it's working for you! I'm sorry the setup for PSES for Vim/Emacs etc. is not the greatest. It's been on our docket to simplify and clean up for a long time but I keep getting pulled into other work.

issue.title: Only Snippets in intellisense (no modules)
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the latest version
- [X] Search the existing issues.

### Steps to reproduce

Using PowerShell Editor Services in neovim with the following LSPConfig:

```lua
local bundle_path = vim.fn.stdpath("data") .. "/mason/packages/powershell-editor-services"
local command_fmt = [[& '%s/PowerShellEditorServices/Start-EditorServices.ps1' -BundledModulesPath '%s' -LogPath '%s/powershell_es.log' -SessionDetailsPath '%s/powershell_es.session.json' -FeatureFlags @() -AdditionalModules @() -HostName nvim -HostProfileId 0 -HostVersion 1.0.0 -Stdio -LogLevel Normal]]
local temp_path = vim.fn.stdpath("cache")
local command = command_fmt:format(bundle_path, bundle_path, temp_path, temp_path)
lspconfig.powershell_es.setup {
  on_attach = on_attach,
  capabilities = capabilities,
  filetypes = { "ps1" },
  bundle_path = vim.fn.stdpath("data") .. "/mason/packages/powershell-editor-services",
  cmd = { "pwsh", "-NoLogo", "-Command", command },
}
```
As part of troubleshooting, I set the cmd to include my profile which had this line:

```powershell
Get-Module -ListAvailable | Import-Module
```

However, still no modules in Intellisense.

### Expected behavior

```console
Typing `Get-C` in a ps1 buffer should display Get-ChildItem in autocomplete
```


### Actual behavior

```console
Type `Get-C` in a ps1 buffer only shows snippets
```


### Error details

_No response_

### Environment data

```PowerShell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.3.6
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.3.6
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.22621
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### Version

3.8.7 - [Mason Registry](https://github.com/mason-org/mason-registry/blob/main/packages/powershell-editor-services/package.yaml)

### Visuals

Example of missing IntelliSense 
![image](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/assets/39483124/67a9f597-6757-4d65-873c-db681632b19b)

Output of :LspInfo
![image](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/assets/39483124/c857bfd3-2ee6-4d90-9c3c-19c0ef1ab98e)

1. Open neovim *on windows*
2. Open the file `a.ps1`

If the same things are done on linux, everything works as expected.

### Expected behavior

```console
PowershellEditorServices should answer the `initialize` request in both windows and linux.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
PowershellEditorServices does not answer the `initiliaze` request on Windows (there is more info in the logs)
```


### Error details

_No response_

### Environment data

```PowerShell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.3.8
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.3.8
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19045
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}

SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### Version

3.13

### Visuals

Powershell logs on Linux (everything works fine here):
[pwsh_linux.log](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/files/13056750/pwsh_linux.log)

Neovim LSP logs on Linux (everything works fine here):
[neovim_linux.log](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/files/13056751/neovim_linux.log)

Powershell logs on Windows (it looks like the server takes too long loading some libraries and then cancels the initialize request):

comment.body:
@andyleejordan confirming that this is the same issue I was having on #2048. Removing my profile, the LSP starts and works as expected. However, I'm not sure how I go about setting the value of `enableProfileLoading`. 

It seems that neovim's LSP doesn't implement it. Is there a way I can pass it in as a parameter to `Start-EditorServices`? Or some other config file?

issue.title: The server never answers to a `initialize` request on Windows over stdio (but it does on Linux) (takes too long loading libraries on Windows)
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the latest version
- [X] Search the existing issues.

### Steps to reproduce

I'm using Neovim as my editor, so I'm using the minimal reproduction of [this issue](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/issues/2810) (but using the `Diagnostic` log level for powershellEditorServices).

1. Open neovim *on windows*
2. Open the file `a.ps1`
3. Nothing happens (the server never answers the `initiliaze` request. There is more info on the logs)

If the same things are done on linux, everything works as expected.

### Expected behavior

```console
PowershellEditorServices should answer the `initialize` request in both windows and linux.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
PowershellEditorServices does not answer the `initiliaze` request on Windows (there is more info in the logs)
```


### Error details

_No response_

### Environment data

```PowerShell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.3.8
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.3.8
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19045
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### Version

3.13

### Visuals

Powershell logs on Linux (everything works fine here):
[pwsh_linux.log](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/files/13056750/pwsh_linux.log)

Neovim LSP logs on Linux (everything works fine here):
[neovim_linux.log](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/files/13056751/neovim_linux.log)

[neovim_windows.log](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/files/13056755/neovim_windows.log)

comment.body: That's right. I would try setting `enableProfileLoading` to `false` in the initialization options you're setting the server up with. `-NoProfile` is parsed by the `pwsh` executable, which is in essence just the host program that runs the LSP server, and that server has its own logic to enable (or disable) profile loading.
